intro: Gomphocarpus suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, cylindrical stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods. It is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested. Gomphocarpus suaveolens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
